page.title: 18Morris Dancing
page.content: Morris dancing at Winster was first documented in 1908,however it had been in existence long before this. During the First World War the dancing lapsed but the group reformed by the early 1920's. The Winster Morris Dancers were very active during the inter-war period and they performed at garden fetes in Winster and throughout the county.The Second World War nearly finished the Winster Morris Men,and it was not until 1951 that the team was reformed. The Winster team comprises 16 dancers,a musician and 4 characters: The King,the Queen,the Jester and the Witch.The King dressed in military uniform,leads the procession,together with the Queen,(a man dressed as a Victorian Lady).The Jester and Witch entertain the crowd during the dances.
